hedline.hl1: Tow Truck Operator Charged by Police

abstract.p: Suffolk County Police arrest Timothy Fitzpatrick, Ronkonkoma tow truck operator whose license to do business in Huntington Town was revoked following complaints that he illegally towed cars and overcharged for their return; he is charged with scheme to defraud motorists (S)

block.p: A Ronkonkoma tow truck operator whose license to do business in Huntington Town was revoked July 1 following complaints that he illegally towed cars and overcharged for their return has been arrested by Suffolk County Police.

Timothy Fitzpatrick, 27, of Islip was arrested Nov. 13 on charges of a scheme to defraud following numerous complaints from motorists that their cars had been towed from Huntington by Mr. Fitzpatrick's company, Turbo Towing. The arrest was made after undercover officers allegedly heard Mr. Fitzpatrick tell someone that he was allowed to tow cars in Huntington.

A Ronkonkoma tow truck operator whose license to do business in Huntington Town was revoked July 1 following complaints that he illegally towed cars and overcharged for their return has been arrested by Suffolk County Police.

Timothy Fitzpatrick, 27, of Islip was arrested Nov. 13 on charges of a scheme to defraud following numerous complaints from motorists that their cars had been towed from Huntington by Mr. Fitzpatrick's company, Turbo Towing. The arrest was made after undercover officers allegedly heard Mr. Fitzpatrick tell someone that he was allowed to tow cars in Huntington.

During a subsequent investigation, the police obtained a search warrant for Turbo Towing in Ronkonkoma, which led to additional charges against Mr. Fitzpatrick including criminal possession of a hypodermic instrument and possession of a controlled substance. He is to appear at First District Court, Central Islip, on Feb. 24.
